argumentText:
The following is a proof of the Waring’s formula using formal power
series. We will work with formal power series in indeterminate $z$ with
coefficients in the ring $\mathbb{Q}[x_1,\ldots,x_n]$. We also need the
following equality $$-\log(1-z) = \sum_{j=1}^\infty \frac{z^j}{j}.$$

Taking log on both sides of
$$1 - \sigma_1z+\ldots + (-1)^n \sigma_n z^n =
  \prod_{m=1}^n(1-x_mz),$$ we get
$$\log(1 - \sigma_1z+\ldots + (-1)^n \sigma_n z^n) =
  \sum_{m=1}^n \log(1-x_mz), \label{eq}$$ Waring’s formula will follow
by comparing the coefficients on both sides.

The right hand side of the above equation equals
$$\sum_{m=1}^n \sum_{j=1}^\infty \frac{x_m^j}{j}z^j$$ or
$$\sum_{j=1}^\infty \left( \sum_{m=1}^n  x_m^j \right)
  \frac{z^j}{j}$$ The coefficient of $z^k$ is equal to $S_k/k$.

On the other hand, the left hand side of can be written as
$$\sum_{j=1}^\infty
 \frac{1}{j}(\sigma_1z-\sigma_2z^2+\ldots+(-1)^{n-1} \sigma_n
 z^n)^j.$$ For each $j$, the coefficient of $z^k$ in
$$(\sigma_1z-\sigma_2z^2+\ldots+(-1)^{n-1} \sigma_n
 z^n)^j$$ is
$$\sum_{i_1,\ldots,i_n} (-1)^{i_2+i_4+i_6+\ldots} \frac{j!}{i_1!\cdots
i_n!}\sigma_1^{i_1} \cdots \sigma_n^{i_n},$$ where the summation is
extended over all $n$-tuple $(i_1,\ldots,i_n)$ whose entries are
non-negative integers, such that $$\begin{gathered}
i_1+i_2+\ldots+i_n = j \\
i_1+2i_2+\ldots +ni_n = k.\end{gathered}$$ So the coefficient of $z^k$
in the left hand side of is
$$\sum_{j=1}^\infty \sum_{i_1,\ldots,i_n} (-1)^{i_2+i_4+i_6+\ldots}
\frac{(j-1)!}{i_1!\cdots i_n!}\sigma_1^{i_1} \cdots
\sigma_n^{i_n},$$ or
$$\sum (-1)^{i_2+i_4+i_6+\ldots} \frac{(i_1+\ldots+i_n-1)!}{i_1!\cdots
i_n!}\sigma_1^{i_1} \cdots \sigma_n^{i_n}.$$ The last summation is over
all $(i_1,\ldots, i_n)\in \mathbb{Z}^n$ with non-negative entries such
that $i_1+2i_2+\ldots+ni_n=k$.
